Dear Ms. Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
A six-month second provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to
the issuance of a provisional license in writing, on the CWL-4617 within 15 days, with
submission of the corrective action plan. If you do not submit the CWL-4617, it will be

treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a provisional license, you must
still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions.
In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please
contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Behavior management
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
Description procedures that describe the institution's behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually
and updated as needed. These shall be available to all residents,
their families, and referring agencies.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff engaged in verbal altercation with youth then tackled youth
to the ground.
Investigation Interviews:
On 11/22/24 Chief Administrator reported an allegation. The
allegation stated that on 11/21/24, Staff 1 was observed in a
verbal altercation with Youth A. Staff 1 appeared to tackle Youth
A, after Youth A punched him in the face. Chief Administrator was
contacted by DCWL and confirmed that Staff 1 was placed on
leave and Youth A did not have any injuries.
Rights Officer was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/25/24 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Rights Officer
indicated there was video of the incident, which showed Staff 1
argued with youth, became physical, and did not remove himself
from the situation timely. Rights Officer provided documents and
video.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 11/25/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. On 11/21/24 Staff 1 and Youth
D were arguing about hygiene products. Youth A said to Youth D,
“guys don’t know what pads are, guys are stupid.” Staff 1
responded by saying, “we’re big dogs, guys are the smartest”.
Staff 1 then walked over to Youth A. Youth A asked, “are you
walking up on me?” Staff 1 answered, “I’m already here. Do
something.” Youth A then hit Staff 1 in the face. Staff 1 responded
by pushing Youth A to the other side of the room and hitting her
twice in the face. Staff 1 attempted to restrain Youth A. Staff 6
stepped in to help, but then let go when Youth A went to the
ground. Staff 1 continued holding Youth A’s arm while she was on
the ground. Youth A yelled at Staff 1 to let go of her and hit him a
few times. Staff 1 twisted Youth A’s arm. Youth A began yelling
2

louder as her arm hurt. Youth D then hit Staff 1 in the head. Staff 1
then let go. Youth A reported her face was red and her shoulder
was sore after the incident. However, she did not want to see a
doctor. During the interview there were no marks or injuries
observed. Youth A stated this was the first time staff had been
physical with her. Youth A never witnessed any staff to hit or
physically discipline anyone else. Youth A reported that staff do
yell and swear at youth at times. Youth A felt there was “too much
disrespect between kids and grow-ups” at the facility. Youth A
indicated she did not feel safe there as she thought staff would
cover for one another and would hide things.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 11/25/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B stated that Staff 1
was talking to Youth A and Youth A yelled, “are you walking up on
me?” Staff 1 stated, “No. I’m just talking to you.” Youth A and Staff
1 went back and forth for a moment repeating the same things.
Then Youth A said she was going to start swinging. Staff 1 said,
“You know the drill if you start swinging.” Staff 1 put his hands out
and said, “what up?” Youth B stated staff previously said if any
kids hit staff, staff will hit them back. Youth B could not recall
which staff said that. Youth A hit Staff 1. Staff 1 then tried to
restrain Youth A but failed. Staff 6 tried to help with the restraint
but was not strong enough. Youth B saw Staff 1 push Youth A up
against the wall, to get the youth off him. Staff 1 then put Youth A
in a chair. Youth D tried to hit Staff 1 during the altercation, but
Staff 1 put his hands up and walked away. Youth B reported the
whole situation occurred because Staff 1 did not know the
difference between a pad and a tampon, and the youth were
making fun of him. Youth B stated that Youth A was wrong for
what she did, but Staff 1 was also wrong to do what he did. Youth
B stated Staff 1 is a good staff and there were no prior incidents
like that. Youth B stated she was not afraid of him or any other
staff.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 11/25/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Staff. Youth C reported that she was
standing at the end of the hall when she observed Staff 1 yelling
at Youth D, because she had called him stupid for not knowing the
difference between tampons and pads. Staff 1 then became
verbally aggressive in Youth A’s face. Youth C could not recall
specifically what Staff 1 said. Youth A punched Staff 1 in the face.
Staff 1 then started punching Youth A in the chest or stomach
area, causing Youth A to fall backwards. Youth C stated her view
was partially obscured, so she could not see exactly where Youth
A was hit. The incident occurred outside of Youth B’s bedroom
3

door, while Youth B was in her room. Staff 6 tried to assist Staff 1
with restraining Youth A, but he was unable to get ahold of Youth
A’s arm and let her go. Additional staff then entered the area and
ended the situation. Youth C stated that prior to anything
happening, Staff 1 entered the unit with a very loud voice, yelling
at Youth D for being loud. Youth C stated this was unusual
behavior for Staff 1, as he did not typically yell. Youth C had never
seen staff harm a youth before. Youth C stated if you did not
follow rules, staff redirect them, but nothing else happens. Youth
C never heard any staff state that youth would be hit if they hit
staff.
Youth D could not be interviewed, as she was discharged from
the facility on 11/24/24. Attempts were made to reach the youth at
her new placement on 12/2/24 and 12/18/24. However, she did
not respond.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/3/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported that around
9:00PM on 11/21/24 Youth A was supposed to be in her room but
kept coming out. Several kids were having trouble settling down
that night and kept getting up requesting something. One girl
needed a book, another had questions, Youth D went to the
bathroom, then asked Staff 1 for a tampon. Staff 1 told Youth D to
wait a second, as he was helping another youth. Youth D became
upset. Staff 1 reminded the youth that they all should have had
their needs finished at 8:45, before bedtime. Staff 1 told the youth
to go to their rooms and wait for the things they asked for.
Youth A asked for a book and Staff 1 told her no, because she
should have gotten it earlier. Youth A then ran from her room to
get a book anyway. Staff 1 went to the hygiene closet to get the
item Youth D needed. Staff 1 could not find the item requested
and gave her a pad to use until Staff 3 could get a tampon from
another unit. Youth A then started going back and forth talking to
him in the hallway. Staff 1 told Youth A she needed to go to her
room. Youth A became argumentative. Staff 1 asked her to relax
and go in her room. Youth A refused to leave the hallway, then
swung and hit Staff 1 in the face. Staff 1 and Staff 6 tried to place
Youth A in a Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) approved standing
hold. However, Staff 6 could not get Youth A’s arm in the right
position. Youth A continued attacking Staff 1. Staff 1 could not get
Youth A in the correct hold, so she was released. A few minutes
later, additional staff came on the unit to assist. Staff 1 denied
pushing or hitting Youth A. Staff 1 stated he never swung at Youth
A or made any type of physical attack towards her. Staff 1 denied
4

calling Youth A or Youth D any names or using inappropriate
language. Staff 1 recalled that Youth D hit him in the back of the
head while he was trying to restrain Youth A.
Staff 1 was informed that the video had been reviewed and it
appeared he tackled Youth A. Staff 1 agreed the hold was not as
learned in CPI training. However, Staff 1 denied pushing Youth A
and stated he must have been off balance and fell. Staff 1 stated
he did not have any prior incidents of this nature.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/3/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported they were
present on the unit prior to the incident, then left for a short time
and returned just after. Around 8:45 that night the youth were
irritated with Staff 2 for pushing them to take care of their hygiene
and other things before bed. Youth A and Youth D became
escalated. Around 9:00 Staff 2 switched out with Staff 1 in hopes
of deescalating the youth. Staff 2 did not see any of the altercation
between Staff 1 and Youth A or Youth D. Staff 2 stated she did not
have any prior concerns about Staff 1 and had never heard the
youth express concerns about him. Staff 2 never heard any staff
indicate they would hit youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/3/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported they did not
see what occurred between Staff 1 and Youth A. However, they
heard Staff 1 yelling at Youth A to stop. Staff 3 saw Youth A swing
her fists at Staff 1’s face and head. Staff 1 had his arms up in a
protective manner. Staff 3 left the unit to get a supervisor to assist.
Staff 3 stated they did not see the restraint. Staff 3 did not have
any concerns about Staff 1 and never observed him to do
anything inappropriate. Staff 3 never heard any staff threaten to hit
youth.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/3/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported they did not
see the full incident. Staff 4 arrived on site when Youth A was
attacking Staff 1 and Youth D was standing in the corner yelling
inappropriate remarks at Staff 1. Staff 1 backed up from Youth A
and asked Staff 5 and Staff 6 why they did not help him. Staff 4
blocked Youth D from reaching Staff 1 as he exited the wing. Staff
4 did not have any prior concerns about Staff 1. Staff 4 never
heard Staff 1 or any other staff threaten to hit youth.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/3/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported they returned
5

from break to see Staff 1 and Youth A talking. Their voices were
elevated and Youth A stated something was not fair. Staff 1 said
he was in charge and that was how things were going to go. Youth
A approached Staff 1 and put her finger in his face. Youth A then
punched Staff 1 a few times. Staff 1 went toward the wall with his
arms open around Youth A, almost in a bear hug. Staff 5
confirmed this was not a CPI approved technique. Staff 1 and
Staff 6 then tried to place Youth A in a CPI standing hold.
However, Staff 6 could not get in the proper position and Youth A
got loose. Youth A hit Staff 1 again. Staff 5 blocked Youth A and
Staff 6 called for the unit to clear. Youth D went to her room. Staff
5 stayed on the wing to help deescalate. Youth A continued to
refuse to go to her room. Staff 1 left the unit, and it took about 45
minutes for Youth A to calm down and go to bed. Staff 5 stated
this was the first time they had this type of behavior from Staff 1.
Staff 5 did not have any prior concerns about Staff 1. Staff 5 never
heard Staff 1 or anyone else previously threaten to hit youth. Staff
5 stated she was unsure if Staff 1 hit Youth A during the attempted
restraint. Everything happened quickly and the view was blocked.
Attempts were made to interview Staff 6 on 12/3/24, 12/5/24 and
12/20/24. On 12/23/24 an interview occurred by phone in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 recalled that youth
were upset as they felt Staff 1 was bossing them around. Youth A
then hit Staff 1. Staff 1 pushed Youth A and attempted to restrain
her. Staff 6 assisted with the restraint but could not get in the right
position and let go. When Youth A began hitting Staff 1, she was
verbally redirected by Staff 6. Staff 6 stated he could not recall
anything else about the incident. When asked if he felt Staff 1’s
actions were appropriate, Staff 6 answered “yes”. When asked if
Staff 1 pushing Youth A was appropriate, Staff 6 said he did not
want to answer that. Staff 6 stated he never saw Staff 1 push or
hit a youth prior to this. Staff 6 was unsure if Staff 1 hit Youth A.
Staff 6 never heard any staff threaten to hit a youth.
Video review:
The video from 11/21/24 did not have audio and part of the view
was obscured. However, it was observed that staff and youth were
walking around the unit. Youth C was at the end of the hallway.
Youth B was in her room, watching the hallway from her window.
Youth D was off camera. Youth A stepped into the hallway and
Staff 1 approached her. Youth A’s arms were raised as she spoke.
Staff 1 walked away, then turned around and returned. Staff 1
walked past Youth A, toward the area where Youth D was off
camera. Staff 1’s facial expressions and arm movements indicated
he was arguing. Staff 6 stepped in between them and Staff 1
6

walked away. Staff 1 began talking with Youth A again. Staff 1
then went into the storage area while Youth A continued talking to
him from the door. Youth A then walked away, over to Youth D.
Youth A made some ‘talking’ hand gestures toward Staff 1. Staff 1
walked away, then returned and exchanged words with Youth A.
Youth A shook her finger at Staff 1. Staff 1 was gesturing at Youth
D and appeared to be arguing with Youth A and Youth D. Staff 6
patted Staff 1’s arm, directing him away. Staff 1 walked up to
Youth A. Youth A stepped closer to Staff 1. The two continued to
argue with their faces close to one another. Youth A put her finger
in Staff 1’s face. Staff 1 moved his body closer to Youth A. Staff 6
stood to the side observing. Youth D then gestured at the camera,
then toward Staff 1. Staff 1 backed away from Youth A and put his
arms out to his sides, as if to say, ‘come get me’. Youth A
responded by punching Staff 1 in the face three times. Staff 1 then
tackled Youth A against the wall with his arms wrapped around
her body. They went off camera. Youth C and Youth D
approached. Youth D hit Staff 1. Staff 5 stepped in between Staff
1 and Youth D. Staff 1 walked onto camera with his hands up.
Staff 6 could be seen in the corner blocking Youth A from going
toward Staff 1. Staff 1 continued to verbally engage with Youth D
for approximately 20 seconds. Youth D walked away, and Staff 1
verbally engaged with Youth A for approximately one minute with
Staff 5 and Staff 6 between them. Youth A then left the unit.
Document review:
• Incident report dated 11/21/2024, authored by Staff 1. The
report was consistent with Staff 1’s interview. However, the
report indicated that Youth A was restrained by Staff 1 and
Staff 6 from 9:15-9:18PM, which was inconsistent with what
was observed on the video.
• CPI is the agency’s approved plan for physical
management. CPI requires the use of de-escalation
techniques prior to utilizing physical restraint. The standing
restraint hold “Team Control Position” requires two staff to
initiate the hold by securing the youth’s arms.
• Human resources file for Staff 1:
o Staff 1 was a new employee that had completed
Orientation from 9/17/24-9/20/24.
o CPI training completed on 9/23/24 and 9/24/24.
o Safety Care part 1 completed on 11/7/2024.
o Staff 1 did not have any prior disciplinary action.
o Staff 1 was terminated 12/20/24.
Analysis Based on interviews with youth and staff, and a review of the
incident on video, a violation was found. Staff 1 engaged in a
7

verbal altercation with Youth A and Youth D. Staff 1 then placed
himself in close proximity to Youth A and failed to make efforts to
deescalate the situation. Staff 1 then took both arms, wrapped
them around Youth A and pushed her toward the wall. Staff 1 then
attempted to restrain Youth A in a Team Control Position. Staff 1’s
attempt to restrain Youth A did not comply with CPI training as
Staff 1 placed Youth A in a “bear hug”, then secured Youth A’s
arm, without Staff 6 having the other arm secured. After additional
staff stepped in to assist, Staff 1 did not promptly remove himself
from the situation, further agitating Youth A and Youth D.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2024C0001153SI dated 3/25/24, CAP approved 4/22/24.
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff pushed youth.
Investigation Interviews:
On 11/25/24 Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. On 11/21/24 Staff 1 and
Youth D were arguing about hygiene products. Youth A then hit
Staff 1 in the face. Staff 1 responded by pushing Youth A to the
other side of the room and hitting her twice in the face.
On 11/25/24 Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B stated that Staff 1
was talking to Youth A and Youth A yelled, “are you walking up on
me?” Staff 1 stated, “No. I’m just talking to you.” Youth A and Staff
1 went back and forth for a moment repeating the same things.
Youth A hit Staff 1. Youth B saw Staff 1 push Youth A up against
the wall.
8

On 11/25/24 Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
in collaboration with MDHHS Staff. Youth C reported that she was
standing at the end of the hall when she observed Staff 1 yelling
at Youth D. Youth A punched Staff 1 in the face. Staff 1 then hit
Youth A in the chest or stomach area, causing Youth A to fall
backwards. Youth C stated her view was partially obscured, so
she could not see exactly where Youth A was hit.
On 12/3/24 Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated he never swung
at Youth A or made any type of physical attack towards her. Staff
1 was informed that the video had been reviewed and it appeared
he tackled Youth A. Staff 1 agreed the hold was not as learned in
CPI training. However, Staff 1 denied pushing Youth A and stated
he must have been off balance and fell.
On 12/3/24 Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported they returned
from break to see Staff 1 and Youth A talking. Their voices were
elevated and Youth A stated something was not fair. Staff 1 said
he was in charge and that was how things were going to go. Youth
A approached Staff 1 and put her finger in his face. Youth A then
punched Staff 1 a few times. Staff 1 went toward the wall with his
arms open around Youth A, almost in a bear hug. Staff 5
confirmed this was not a CPI approved technique.
Attempts were made to interview Staff 6 on 12/3/24, 12/5/24 and
12/20/24. On 12/23/24 an interview occurred by phone in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 recalled that youth
were upset as they felt Staff 1 was bossing them around. Youth A
then hit Staff 1. Staff 1 pushed Youth A and attempted to restrain
her.
Video review:
The video from 11/21/24 did not have audio and part of the view
was obscured. However, it was observed that after some back-
and-forth discussion, Youth A put her finger in Staff 1’s face. Staff
1 moved his body closer to Youth A. Staff 6 stood to the side
observing. Youth D then gestured at the camera, then toward Staff
1. Staff 1 backed away from Youth A and put his arms out to his
sides, as if to say, ‘come get me’. Youth A responded by punching
Staff 1 in the face three times. Staff 1 then tackled Youth A
against the wall with his arms wrapped around her body.
9

Analysis Based on interviews with youth and staff, and a review of the
incident on video, a violation was found. Staff 1 was observed to
use both arms, wrapped them around Youth A and pushed her
toward the wall.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the license be modified to a Second Provisional License.
